content.text: 1 (a) Use standard results from the list of formulae (MF19) to show that
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined. [3]
2 The cubic equation \(x^3 + 2x + 1 = 0\) has roots \(\alpha, \beta, \gamma\).
(a) Find a cubic equation whose roots are \(\alpha^3 - 1, \beta^3 - 1, \gamma^3 - 1\). [3]
(b) Find the value of \((\alpha^3 - 1)^2 + (\beta^3 - 1)^2 + (\gamma^3 - 1)^2\). [2]
(c) Find the value of \((\alpha^3 - 1)^3 + (\beta^3 - 1)^3 + (\gamma^3 - 1)^3\).
3 The sequence \(u_1, u_2, u_3, \ldots\) is such that \(u_1 = 5\) and \(u_{n+1} = 6u_n + 5\) for \(n \ge 1\).
(a) Prove by induction that \(u_n = 6^n - 1\) for all positive integers \(n\). [5]
(b) Deduce that \(u_{2n}\) is divisible by \(u_n\) for \(n \ge 1\). [2]

4 The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) is given by \(\mathbf{M} = \left( \begin{array}{cc}1 & 2\\ 0 & 1 \end{array} \right) \left( \begin{array}{cc}\cos \theta & -\sin \theta \\ \sin \theta & \cos \theta \end{array} \right)\) , where \(0 < \theta < 2\pi\) .

(a) The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) represents a sequence of two geometrical transformations in the \(x - y\) plane. State the type of each transformation, and make clear the order in which they are applied. [2]
(b) Find the value of \(\theta\) for which the transformation represented by \(\mathbf{M}\) has a line of invariant points. [7]
5 The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = \theta e^{\frac{1}{\theta}\theta}\) , for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant 2\pi\) .
(a) Sketch \(C\) .

(b) Find the area of the region bounded by \(C\) and the initial line, giving your answer in the form \(\left(p\pi^2 + q\pi + r\right)e^{\frac{1}{2}\pi} + s\) , where \(p, q, r\) and \(s\) are integers to be determined. [6]
(c) Show that, at the point of \(C\) furthest from the initial line,
and verify that this equation has a root between 5 and 5.05. [5]
6 The points \(A, B, C\) have position vectors
respectively.
(a) Find the equation of the plane \(ABC\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\). [5]
A point \(D\) has position vector \(\mathbf{i} + t\mathbf{k}\) , where \(t \neq - 2\) .
(b) Find the acute angle between the planes \(ABC\) and \(ABD\). [4]
(c) Find the values of \(t\) such that the shortest distance between the lines \(AB\) and \(CD\) is \(\sqrt{2}\). [7]
7 The curve \(C\) has equation \(y = \frac{2x^2 - 5x}{2x^2 - 7x - 4}\) .
(a) Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\). [2]
(b) Find the coordinates of any stationary points on \(C\). [4]
(c) Sketch \(C\) , stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes.
(d) Sketch the curve with equation \(y = \left| \frac{2x^2 - 5x}{2x^2 - 7x - 4} \right|\) .
(e) Find in exact form the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\left| \frac{2x^2 - 5x}{2x^2 - 7x - 4} \right| < \frac{1}{9}\).
